revised_title: Temperature-Dependent Sex Determination and Its Impact on Crocodilian Populations
tldr: This study examines the relationship between temperature-dependent sex determination, sex ratio, and survivorship in crocodilian populations. The authors develop a nonlinear age-structured model to analyze population dynamics and conclude that temperature-dependent sex determination provides a compromise that maintains an unbalanced sex ratio while offering the advantages of sexual reproduction. The model reflects the selective advantages of environmental determination over genetic sex and highlights the importance of temperature in controlling growth, development, and survival of crocodilians.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ecology and Environmental Science
